title: Charging process - rod sphere wire and ground

content.description: A negatively charged rod is brought close to, but does not touch, an isolated, neutral conducting sphere, as shown. A grounded conducting wire is touched to the right side of the sphere and then removed. Finally, the rod is pulled away from the sphere.
content.question: Which of the following correctly indicates whether the final charge on the sphere is positive or negative, and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: Positive, because negative charge carriers have moved from the sphere to ground.
Positive, because positive charge carriers have moved from ground to the sphere.
Negative, because negative charge carriers have moved from ground to the sphere.
Negative, because positive charge carriers have moved from the sphere to ground.

content.answer: Positive, because negative charge carriers have moved from the sphere to ground.
